Description: Hematite cylinder-seal; the suppliant goddess and the robed king with one hand raised face the ascending sun god who rests his foot on a rectangular mountain beneath a crescent moon; in the field between the first two figures are a pot above a ball-and-staff. An inscription was erased and instead were cut a kilted figure who carries an axe over his shoulder and raises one hand, and a spear (probably masking one of the inscription frames).
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (325)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
